message:
The resumption of *that* async method does always use the thread pool. When that async method finishes, its task completes. If another async method is awaiting on that task, then *that* async method has its own context captured (or not).

So, the resuming context decision is made only for that await. If a higher-level method does not use ConfigureAwait(false) - i.e., it wants to resume in its context - then it doesn't matter whether a lower-level method uses ConfigureAwait(false) or not.
